step: Preheat oven to 400. Mince roasted red peppers. In a large ovenproof skillet or medium baking dish, combine tomatoes, shallot, garlic, roasted red pepper, and all but 1 tablespoon oil. Season with salt and red pepper flakes and toss to combine.

Place feta into center of tomato mixture and drizzle with remaining 1 tablespoon oil. Scatter thyme sprigs over tomatoes. Bake for 40 to 45 minutes, until tomatoes are bursting and feta is golden on top.
Meanwhile, in a large pot of boiling salted water, cook pasta until al dente according to package directions. Reserve 1/2 cup pasta water before draining.
To skillet with tomatoes and feta, add cooked pasta, reserved pasta water, and stir until combined.

In a medium sized mixing bowl, add boneless skinless chicken breast, 1 tablespoon of the soy sauce, 2 teaspoons of the rice wine vinegar, and 1.5 teaspoons of the cornstarch.Toss to coat the chicken well, and set aside for later.

In a small sized mixing bowl, add 1/2 cup water, hoisin sauce, garlic, fresh ginger root, 2 tablespoons of the soy sauce, 1 tablespoon of the rice wine vinegar, 1 1/2 teaspoons of cornstarch, and crushed red pepper. Stir to mix well. Set aside for later.

In a wok, or large nonstick skillet, add 2 teaspoons of canola oil. Heat over medium/high heat.When hot, add coated chicken. Stir frequently, and cook approximatley 5 minutes, or until chicken has cooked through, and is lightly browned.Remove chicken from wok and set aside for later.
Return the chicken to the wok, and add scallions and peanuts. Toss to mix in, and cook until heated.
Cook a cup of jasmine rice
Heat the oil in a large, deep skillet over medium heat until simmering. Add the bell pepper, ginger and garlic; cook, stirring occasionally, until fragrant, about one minute.
Stir in the curry paste and saute for one minute. Add the coconut milk, water, salt and pepper, and stir to combine.

Bring the mixture to a simmer, stir in the shrimp and bok choi and continue to simmer, stirring occasionally, until the shrimp are pink and opaque, the bell pepper is just tender and the bok choi is wilted 3-4 minutes. Remove from the heat, stir in the lime juice and cilantro. Serve immediately over rice

In the same wok or skillet, add 1 teaspoon canola oil, and heat over medium/high heat.When hot, add sweet red pepper, celery, and broccoli florets stir and cook for approximately 4 minutes, or until tender yet crisp.Add in sauce mixture and heat to a boil, stirring occasionally.Cook and stir approximately 30 seconds, or until the sauce has thickened.
